question_text:
What is the volume?
 _ cubic millimetres
backend_description: Shows a rectangular prism with dimensions labeled as 9 mm length, 8 mm width, and 10 mm height. The 3D shape is shown in perspective view with visible edges to help students identify all three dimensions needed for volume calculation.
solution_image_tag: Shows the volume formula calculation: Volume = length x width x height, with the values 9 x 8 x 10 substituted and multiplied to get 720. The clear step-by-step layout helps students see how to apply the rectangular prism volume formula.
solution:
Find the length, width, and height of the rectangular prism.
Length = 9 mm, width = 8 mm, height = 10 mm.
Use these numbers in the formula for area of a rectangular prism: length x breadth x height
The volume is 720 cubic millimetres.
